content.description:
Work up large flat edges leading up and left before a long reach out right to the lip of the boulder. Downclimb the slabby south side of the boulder to descend.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #663, Unnamed.
content.location:
Left side of the west face and left of

Tooth Hurty

.

content.description:
Work large edges up and right to the lip of the boulder and mantle over to finish. Downclimb the slabby south side of the boulder to descend.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Right side of the west face and right of

Tooth or Dare

.

content.description:
Sit start with hands on two widely spaced holds.   The right hand starts at the flake crack around the arete.

Pull on and move your hands higher, right on a good flake and left on a pinch.   Make a tricky move with the right foot and grab the lip of the boulder with the right hand.   Bust a move to fit the left in the slot above, then finish more easily up the slab above.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
